SEARCH
Package de.flyndre.fleventsbackend.controller

Klasse PostController

java.lang.Object
de.flyndre.fleventsbackend.controller.PostController
@RestController @CrossOrigin @RequestMapping("/api/events/{eventId}/posts") public class PostController extends Object
This Class is the Controller for the REST-API path "/api/events". It provides an interface regarding posts.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • PostController

  • Methodendetails

    • getPosts

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getPosts(@PathVariable String eventId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Returns a list with all posts of the specified event. Allows access for guest and above.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event to get the posts from
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      ResponseEntity a list of the posts and the http status code

    • getPost

      @GetMapping("/{postId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getPost(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Returns a single, specified post from the specified event. Allows access for guest and above.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event to get the post from
      postId - the id of the post
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      ResponseEntity with the post and the http status code

    • createPost

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createPost(@PathVariable String eventId, @RequestPart Post post, @Nullable @RequestPart List<org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile> attachments, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Creates a post in the specified id by the specified account. Allows access for tutor and above.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event to create the post in
      post - the post to be created
      attachments - some files to add as an attachment.
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      ResponseEntity with the created post and the http status code

    • updatePost

      @PostMapping("/{postId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updatePost(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, @Nullable @RequestPart Post post, @Nullable @RequestPart List<org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile> attachments, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Updates an existing post.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the event of the post
      postId - the id of the post to update
      post - the post with all parameters set that should be updated
      attachments - attachments to add to the post
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      the updated post or an error if something went wrong.

    • deletePost

      @DeleteMapping("/{postId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deletePost(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Deleting an Post and all comments of it.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of event of the post
      postId - the id of the post to be deleted
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      ok or an error if something went wrong

    • createComment

      @PostMapping("/{postId}/comments") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createComment(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, @RequestBody PostComment comment, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Creates a comment under the specified post by the specified account in the specified event. Allows access for tutor and above.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event with the post to create the comment under
      postId - the id of the post in the event to create the comment under
      comment - the comment to be created
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      ResponseEntity with the commented post and the http status code

    • deleteComment

      @DeleteMapping("/{postId}/comments/{commentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteComment(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, @PathVariable String commentId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Delete a comment and all its associations.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the event of the post of the comment
      postId - the post of the comment
      commentId - the id of the comment to delete
      authentication - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      Ok or an error if something went wrong.

    • getAttachment

      @GetMapping("/attachments/{attachmentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAttachment(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String attachmentId)
      Returns the file that is represented by the attachment id.
      Parameter:
      eventId - id of the event of the post to which the attachment is binded
      attachmentId - the id of the attachment
      Gibt zurück:
      the raw file or an error if something went wrong.

    • addAttachment

      @PostMapping("/{postId}/attachments") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addAttachment(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String postId, @RequestBody org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile attachment, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Adds a MultipartFile as an attachment to an existing post.
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event of the post
      postId - the id of the post to add to
      attachment - the MultipartFile to add
      auth - the Authentication generated out of a barer token.
      Gibt zurück:
      the manipulated post or an error if something went wrong

    • deleteAttachment

      @DeleteMapping("/attachments/{attachmentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteAttachment(@PathVariable String eventId, @PathVariable String attachmentId, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
      Delete an Attachment form a Post
      Parameter:
      eventId - the id of the event of the post
      attachmentId - the id of the attachment to delete
      Gibt zurück:
      ok if successful or en error of something went wrong
